response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "medium", "At 18, immaturity and limited life experience can increase risk, although youth alone is not definitive."],
    ["Race", "low", "While the subject identifies as Black, modern risk assessment avoids using race as a primary indicator, so its weight is minimized."],
    ["Criminal History", "medium", "Having been arrested twice raises concern; however, the lack of convictions means the legal system did not confirm delinquent behavior."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Past use of marijuana in the last four years introduces a moderate risk factor, although it is less severe than other substances."],
    ["Living Situation", "medium", "Living alone may indicate less social support, contributing moderately to recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment", "low", "Having held two jobs in the past year indicates some engagement with structured activity, reducing recidivism risk."],
    ["Education", "low", "Enrollment in school is a protective factor that typically correlates with lower recidivism."],
    ["Family Background", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household of moderate size can sometimes be linked with environmental risk factors."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "A belief that God influences personal events can serve as a protective factor by promoting adherence to social norms."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: At 18, immaturity and limited life experience can increase risk, although youth alone is not definitive.
While the subject identifies as Black, modern risk assessment avoids using race as a primary indicator, so its weight is minimized.
Having been arrested twice raises concern; however, the lack of convictions means the legal system did not confirm delinquent behavior.
Past use of marijuana in the last four years introduces a moderate risk factor, although it is less severe than other substances.
Living alone may indicate less social support, contributing moderately to recidivism risk.
Having held two jobs in the past year indicates some engagement with structured activity, reducing recidivism risk.
Enrollment in school is a protective factor that typically correlates with lower recidivism.
Growing up in an urban household of moderate size can sometimes be linked with environmental risk factors.
A belief that God influences personal events can serve as a protective factor by promoting adherence to social norms.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 2 inches and weighs 230 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He is enrolled in school at the present moment. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
